item.title: OPEC  Output Signals Spur Options Bets Oil Will Lurch Below $60

review.headline_rewrite: OPEC  Output Signals Spur Options Bets Oil Will Lurch Below $60
bullets: Oil has been locked in a tight range since early August as traders try to reconcile increased OPEC output with tightness in US markets
Bloomberg reported that OPEC leader Saudi Arabia wants the group to consider reviving more oil production ahead of schedule to help reclaim market share.
Broader oil options pricing had already taken a more pessimistic tilt as the summer driving season came to an end, with puts fetching the
Oil sliding below $60 a barrel would be a major win for President Donald Trump, who has repeatedly tried to jawbone prices lower.

item.title: Dollar drops against peers after weaker-than-expected jobs report

review.headline_rewrite: Dollar drops against peers after weaker-than-expected jobs report
bullets: The greenback dropped 0.91% to 0.79830 against the Swiss franc and was poised for the fourth consecutive week of losses against the currency.

The rate-sensitive 2-year note yield fell 8.1 basis points to 3.511%.
